xyz.msws.nope.modules.data

Class PlayerOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • xyz.msws.nope.modules.data.PlayerOption
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Option

    public class PlayerOption
extends java.lang.Object
implements Option
    A PlayerOption represents a Boolean value for a specified player
    Author:
    imodm

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerOption(CPlayer cp, java.lang.String key)
      Construct a PlayerOption, the data is automatically loaded and assigned if available
      PlayerOption(CPlayer cp, java.lang.String key, boolean def)
      Same as the parent constructor however allows for specifying a default (def) value if the player doesn't have it originally set

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getKey()
      This should return a unique identifier for a specific option.
      java.util.List<? extends java.lang.Object> getOptions()
      Returns the list of options, the first item in this list should be the default
      java.lang.Boolean getValue()
      Returns the current value of the option
      java.lang.Boolean set(java.lang.Object value)
      Set a value, should be used for Strings or non-boolean values.
      java.lang.Boolean toggle()
      Toggle a value, this can be used to iterate through the list of Option.getOptions().
